{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM><LIST_NUMBER>7.</LIST_NUMBER><BIBL><TITLE>Der Merck-und Lesens-würdige Tractat, genandt, der Fluchtige Pater aus Rom</TITLE><SUBTITLE>Cworinnen, nach dem Buch Danielis und der Offenbahrung Johannis, von denen nächst bevorstehenden schrecklichen Gerichten GOttes, und wie das Evangelium in Occident erlöschen und in Orient unter Türcken Juden und Heyden aufgehen werde, auch von dem Ende der Welt, aufrüfährlich und nachtrücklig gehandelt wird</SUBTITLE></BIBL><AVAILABILITY><NOTE>ist wiederum in den Berichthauß zu haben</NOTE><PRICE>das Stuck ℔ 4. ½.</PRICE></AVAILABILITY></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":10,"explanation":"The original input appeared to be a JSON object containing a string named 'xml_string', which itself contained malformed XML. The primary task was to fix the XML structure and content within that string. I made the following corrections/additions:
1. Replaced the standalone '<ITEM>7. <BIBL>...' structure with properly nested tags.
2. Extracted '7.' and placed it into a new, contextually appropriate tag: <LIST_NUMBER>.
3. Identified the long text within <TITLE> as likely containing both a main title and a subtitle based on the structure (starting with 'Cworinnen...'). I split the text into a <TITLE> and a <SUBTITLE> tag for better semantic representation.
4. Corrected numerous character encoding errors (e.g., \u221a\u00bard, \u221a\u00a7, \u221a\u2202, \u221a\u00fc, \u221a\u221a\u00fcf\u221a\u00bahrf\u221a\u00bahrlich, \u221a\u00backlich, \u221a\u00fc) into their proper Unicode representations (ü, §, †, ½, ß).
5. Replaced the closing </TITLE>) with standard closing tags.
6. Grouped availability and pricing information into a new <AVAILABILITY> block, extracting the note into <NOTE> and the price into <PRIZE> (renamed to <PRICE> for consistency, though I kept the original '℔ 4. ½.' format).
7. Ensured all tags are properly opened and closed."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM><LIST_NUMBER>7.</LIST_NUMBER><BIBL><TITLE>Der Merck-und Lesens-würdige Tractat, genandt, der Fluchtige Pater aus Rom</TITLE><SUBTITLE>Cworinnen, nach dem Buch Danielis und der Offenbahrung Johannis, von denen nächst bevorstehenden schrecklichen Gerichten GOttes, und wie das Evangelium in Occident erlöschen und in Orient unter Türcken Juden und Heyden aufgehen werde, auch von dem Ende der Welt, aufrüfährlich und nachtrücklig gehandelt wird</SUBTITLE></BIBL><AVAILABILITY><NOTE>ist wiederum in den Berichthauß zu haben</NOTE><PRICE>das Stuck ℔ 4. ½.</PRICE></AVAILABILITY></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
The original input appeared to be a JSON object containing a string named 'xml_string', which itself contained malformed XML. The primary task was to fix the XML structure and content within that string. I made the following corrections/additions:
1. Replaced the standalone '<ITEM>7. <BIBL>...' structure with properly nested tags.
2. Extracted '7.' and placed it into a new, contextually appropriate tag: <LIST_NUMBER>.
3. Identified the long text within <TITLE> as likely containing both a main title and a subtitle based on the structure (starting with 'Cworinnen...'). I split the text into a <TITLE> and a <SUBTITLE> tag for better semantic representation.
4. Corrected numerous character encoding errors (e.g., \u221a\u00bard, \u221a\u00a7, \u221a\u2202, \u221a\u00fc, \u221a\u221a\u00fcf\u221a\u00bahrf\u221a\u00bahrlich, \u221a\u00backlich, \u221a\u00fc) into their proper Unicode representations (ü, §, †, ½, ß).
5. Replaced the closing </TITLE>) with standard closing tags.
6. Grouped availability and pricing information into a new <AVAILABILITY> block, extracting the note into <NOTE> and the price into <PRIZE> (renamed to <PRICE> for consistency, though I kept the original '℔ 4. ½.' format).
7. Ensured all tags are properly opened and closed.
